channel.title: Best forum system
channel.description:
Yes, I really am asking this question!!!
I think that SMF is the best -- I have it on my site. it's free, easy and most importantly it is powerful.
Please do leave any comments! :D

item.title: Best forum system
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“Xerxes, post:19, topic:13674”]I use SMF; however I like Invision & vBulletin also.

SMF could use more features, and most of the features dosen’t exist as mods either, for example a warning system similiar to Invision would be nice. Perhaps more features that vBulletin and Invision have that other dosen’t have. I have heard that the next release of SMF will be shexy with alot of new features, atleast that’s what I have heard, it will also include a warning system if I am not wrong but I couldn’t care less about that right now, there are more important features that could of been used in SMF.

Permissions in SMF are a bitch too, I hate it. It takes ages and It gets confusing. But well, yup. It’s still cool.[/quote]

But its those confusing permissions that make SMF very secure. I thought that vBulletin had the best security but SMF is at least as secure (if not more secure) than vBulletin.

Read full topic

item.title: Best forum system
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

[quote=“DeadBird, post:16, topic:13674”]SMF
Why?

  • Free
  • Secure
  • Legal
  • Easy to mod
  • Easy to skin
  • As the name contains,Simple.
  • User Friendly[/quote]

Thats why I use it :). I don’t know why you’d use anything else when everything you need is in SMF (and its free)! I can see why mopar uses it

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I voted SMF over the others. vB is costly, and the rest I’ve never tried/didn’t like.

item.title: Best forum system
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

i dont like smf having to download all of that for one forum… no thanks and besides i have multiple formats of backgrounds i can use infact i can make my own besides… i have tried smf and i dont even know how to make a website… i just downloaded it and now im stuck… lol

You’d be better with someone like SmfHost, Smfweb or InvisionFree, because they host it for you, all you have to worry about is the forums themselves.

Read full topic

item.title: Best forum system
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

i dont like smf having to download all of that for one forum… no thanks and besides i have multiple formats of backgrounds i can use infact i can make my own besides… i have tried smf and i dont even know how to make a website… i just downloaded it and now im stuck… lol

Read full topic

item.title: Best forum system
item.dc:creator: @ada ada
item.description:
@ada wrote:

ThAt0n36Uy:

i have used invisionfree for 2 years mainly messing around with it and experimenting and theres so much more you can do with it… so i pick invisionfree

Have you tried SMF though?[br][size=1]Posted at: September 10, 2006, 02:19:44 PM[/size][hr][quote=“xerozcheez, post:8, topic:13674”]vBulletin - has fairly good secuirity and great features
invision - has not so good secuirity but is a bit easier to use and still has decent features
SMF - has best secuirity but not as many features as the others[/quote]

Don’t forget there are a lot of extentions for SMF out there, so chances are if you’re looking out for something theres a mod catering for it.

SMFs themes are way better too. You can have just as many users with SMF as any other forum (someone said that invision can handle more users than SMF)

Read full topic
